remarks: The defining property of a Ramsey number.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Apr-2015.)
statement:
rami.c $e |- C = ( a e. _V , i e. NN0 |-> { b e. ~P a | ( # ` b ) = i } ) $.
rami.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN0 ) $.
rami.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. V ) $.
rami.f $e |- ( ph -> F : R --> NN0 ) $.
rami.x $e |- ( ph -> ( M Ramsey F ) e. NN0 ) $.
rami.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. W ) $.
rami.l $e |- ( ph -> ( M Ramsey F ) <_ ( # ` S ) ) $.
rami.g $e |- ( ph -> G : ( S C M ) --> R ) $.
rami $p |- ( ph -> E. c e. R E. x e. ~P S ( ( F ` c ) <_ ( # ` x ) /\ ( x C M ) C_ ( `' G " { c } ) ) ) $.
$d C c x $.
$d F c x $.
$d G c x $.
$d M a b c i x $.
$d R c x $.
$d S c x $.
$d V c x $.
$d c ph x $.
